name: First Sunday Concert Series
shortDescription: Artists for February are three doctoral candidates: pianists Sichun Gao and Jing Li, and violinist Ziqian Ye.
fullDescription:
Desert Rose Bahá'í Institute continues its acclaimed First Sunday Concert Series, bringing world-class artistry to Southern Arizona. On February 1 at 3:00 p.m., Hadden Hall hosts three exceptional doctoral candidates from the University of Arizona's School of Music: pianists Sichun Gao and Jing Li, and violinist Ziqian Ye.

**A Historic Instrument:**
The pianists will perform on Desert Rose's recently acquired and fully restored 1893 A.B. Chase grand piano, showcasing the rich, warm tones that made these instruments treasured in the gilded age.

**Music That Heals:**
The program features works by Brahms and Rachmaninoff—compositions recognized by music therapists for their capacity to heal emotional disorders such as depression and melancholy. These masterworks demonstrate music's power to lift the soul toward heaven.

**Details:**
- **When:** Sunday, February 1, 2025, 3:00 p.m.
- **Where:** Hadden Hall, 1950 West William Sears Drive, Eloy, Arizona 85131
- **Artists:** Sichun Gao (piano), Jing Li (piano), Ziqian Ye (violin)
- **Admission:** Free

An afternoon of transcendent music and world-class artistry.
title: First Sunday Concert Series
